item.title: Fourth update-pack for Manjaro 0.8.7
item.dc:creator: philm
item.description: Almost two weeks passed since the last update in our stable branch. This time it took us a little longer to prepare the update-pack for you. Also we are happy to see some Community Editions based on our latest stable release online. Thanks flies out to our Community Maintainers of those editions. This update will […]
item.content:encoded:
Almost two weeks passed since the last update in our stable branch. This time it took us a little longer to prepare the update-pack for you. Also we are happy to see some Community Editions based on our latest stable release online. Thanks flies out to our Community Maintainers of those editions.

This update will automatically correct the issue with our MATE edition missing the Mate-Repository. Also we updated Firefox and Thunderbird to the latest 24-series. As always regular upstream updates by Archlinux (2013-10-01 17:35 CEST).

Guillaume worked hard to update our graphical package manager Pamac. Now we use more parts directly from alpm so dependency management is much better now as before. Therefore we modified pyalpm. The UI got a redesign in some parts.

Features of Pamac 0.8

  • stable backend for updates or transactions
  • redesigned transaction progress window with details expander
  • post-install script output is visble in this expander
  • you can install local packages from pamac-manager (you can also do it from cli with pamac-install cmd or from your file manager)

We have now over 55.200 Downloads in total for Manjaro 0.8.7 and already over 40,100 for 0.8.7.1. This is of the charts and shows us how popular we already are. We hope you enjoy Manjaro as we developers and supporters do.

Current supported kernels

  • Linux34 3.4.63 – our default kernel series for Manjaro 0.8.7
  • Linux38 3.8.13.10 – stable extended support kernel maintained by Canonical
  • Linux310 3.10.13 – it gets better with each update …
  • Linux311 3.11.2 – current stable release by Linus. AMD users should check out the new power support

Key-Updates:

  • Kernels 3.4.63, 3.8.13.10, 3.10.13, 3.11.2
  • Pamac 0.8.1
  • Octopi 0.3-dev
  • Firefox 24.0
  • Thunderbird 24.0

Changes in Detail:

  • stable community i686: 246 new and 258 removed package(s)
  • stable community x86_64: 244 new and 255 removed package(s)
  • stable core i686: 34 new and 33 removed package(s)
  • stable core x86_64: 34 new and 33 removed package(s)
  • stable extra i686: 374 new and 369 removed package(s)
  • stable extra x86_64: 370 new and 365 removed package(s)
  • stable multilib x86_64: 16 new and 17 removed package(s)

Update instructions:

Update your system as usual with pamac, octopi or pacman:

sudo pacman -Syu

If you update with pamac you have to close the updater after pamac 0.8.1 got installed.
We changed the polkit engine. Simply restart pamac-manager or pamac-updater.

Notice: You might have to wait until your mirror has synced.
Please check: http://repo.manjaro.org

Tip: KDE 4.11 includes a reworked OpenGL 2 compositor. OpenGL 3.1 got introduced. By default OpenGL 2 with the fallback to OpenGL 1 is used. If the hardware doesn’t support OpenGL 3.1 it automatically falls back to OpenGL 2 or OpenGL 1. When running kwin_gles KDE defaults to OpenGL ES 3.0 if present otherwise OpenGL ES 2.0 is used. Catalyst Legacy seems to have issues with this change. Here is a workaround to get it working:

#!/bin/bash
export $(dbus-launch)
export KWIN_DIRECT_GL=1
export KWIN_COMPOSE=O2
kwin --replace &

Save it as a script and place it into your ~/.config/autostart dir. It is also possible to disable compositing till upstream fixes the bug.

This respin is based on the 3.10 kernel series and ships E17 0.17.4, Firefox 23.0.1, Pamac 0.7.6 […]
item.content:encoded:
On behalf of the Manjaro Turkey Community we are happy to announce our E17 Respin of Manjaro Linux ‘Ascella’. We thank the Manjaro developers putting up this nice platform to easily create our own custom spin of Manjaro.

This respin is based on the 3.10 kernel series and ships E17 0.17.4, Firefox 23.0.1, Pamac 0.7.6 and VLC 2.0.8a as media player.

With this release the turkish community adds a nice styled install media in addition to all official released editions by Manjaro developers. This respin is based on the stable branch, can be used for daily bases and easily installed by graphical or text installers.

Sadly we missed to add any polkit agent to these install medias. Please use followed cmd to fix it in a terminal:

sudo pacman -Sy lxpolkit


Please also read the 63 pages Beginners Guide to help you thru the installation process.

All the best

Tulliana & Cumali- Manjaro Turkey

Live Media features:

  • Kernel: 3.10.12
  • Xorg: 1.14.2
  • Webbrowser: Firefox 23.0.1
  • Media Player: VLC 2.0.8a
  • Pacman 4.1.2
  • Package Manager: Pamac 0.7.6
  • Desktop: MATE 1.6.1
  • Live-Installer 0.8.7.1
  • Pulseaudio support
  • Latest free and proprietary drivers
  • Update-Packs 1, 2 & 3 included

item.content:encoded:
Seems Manjaro is in good shape. We have now over 54,500 Downloads in total for Manjaro 0.8.7 and already over 11,400 for 0.8.7.1. So over 65.000 Downloads!!! With this update pack we introduce KDE 4.11.1. Steam got a new client update. A new alienarena release is also there. Octopi got few new features and updates and I compiled a new tox client. As always regular upstream updates by Archlinux (2013-09-15 11:25 CEST).

Current supported kernels

  • Linux34 3.4.62 – our default kernel series for Manjaro 0.8.7
  • Linux38 3.8.13.9 – stable extended support kernel maintained by Canonical
  • Linux310 3.10.11 – it gets better with each update …
  • Linux311 3.11.1 – current stable release by Linus. AMD users should check out the new power support

Tip: KDE 4.11 includes a reworked OpenGL 2 compositor. OpenGL 3.1 got introduced. By default OpenGL 2 with the fallback to OpenGL 1 is used. If the hardware doesn’t support OpenGL 3.1 it automatically falls back to OpenGL 2 or OpenGL 1. When running kwin_gles KDE defaults to OpenGL ES 3.0 if present otherwise OpenGL ES 2.0 is used. Catalyst Legacy seems to have issues with this change. Here is a workaround to get it working:

#!/bin/bash
export $(dbus-launch)
export KWIN_DIRECT_GL=1
export KWIN_COMPOSE=O2
kwin --replace &

Save it as a script and place it into your ~/.config/autostart dir. It is also possible to disable compositing till upstream fixes the bug.

  • Kernels 3.4.62, 3.8.13.9, 3.10.12, 3.11.1

item.title: Manjaro 0.8.7.1 – Back to the future – released
item.dc:creator: philm
item.description: On behalf of the Manjaro development team I’m happy to announce our updated stable release of Manjaro Linux ‘Ascella’. The last two weeks we tweaked and enhanced our current stable release to make it even better. The live-installer got simplified to make it even smoother to install Manjaro. Now we support optional plymouth to be […]
item.content:encoded:
On behalf of the Manjaro development team I’m happy to announce our updated stable release of Manjaro Linux ‘Ascella’. The last two weeks we tweaked and enhanced our current stable release to make it even better.

The live-installer got simplified to make it even smoother to install Manjaro. Now we support optional plymouth to be installed. Linux310-series is now used, which gives you more hardware support than our last stable release. This release includes both update-packs we released the past two weeks.

Grammar issues and little changes make the welcome screen an even better introduction to Manjaro Linux. Important information and links to our forum, wiki and documentation plus buttons to start our graphical and text installers give you an amazing entry to this distro.

With help of our 63 pages Beginners Guide it is easy for you get started and to be guided thru the installation process. One document you should read first!

Users running Manjaro 0.8.7 don’t need to reinstall. A simple upgrade procedure with our package managers will give you the same features as in this maintenance release.

All the best

Philip Müller

Live Media features:

  • Kernel: 3.10.11 LTS
  • Xorg: 1.14.2
  • Webbrowser: Firefox 22.0.1
  • Email Client: Thunderbird 17.0.8 (XFCE only)
  • Media Player: VLC 2.0.8a,
  • Package Manager: Pamac 0.7.5.2 (XFCE), Octopi 0.2.0a (Openbox)
  • Whisker Menu 1.1.1 (XFCE only)
  • Mint Display Manager 1.3.1 (XFCE only)
  • Slim Display Manager 1.3.5 (Openbox only)
  • Manjaro Settings Manager 0.1.2
  • Live-Installer 0.8.7.1
  • Minimalistic XFCE 4.10 Desktop (XFCE only)
  • Minimalistic Openbox 3.5.0 Desktop (Openbox only)
  • PA-mixer replaced pn-mixer and volumeicon
  • Better pulseaudio support
  • Latest free and proprietary drivers
